title.narrative: Danish Church Aid activities in Syria and Lebanon, 2015

description.narrative: Lebanon Contribute to improved basic living conditions and reduced physical and psychological hardship amongst 1300 most vulnerable displaced Palestinian refugees from Syria (DPRS) and host families living in Palestinian refugee camps in Tyre and Saida area, in Southern Lebanon. The target group is vulnerable, displaced Palestinian refugees from Syria (DPRS) and host families in refugee camps in Tyre and Saida area, in Southern Lebanon. Syria: The project purpose, is to improve human security and establish conditions for the safe return of approximately 25,000 war affected people in Kobane through survey, clearance of land contaminated by Explosive Remnants of War (ERW) and booby traps and Risk Education/Awareness activities. In addition, the project will also reduce the risk posed by ERW to populations in hard to reach (besieged) conflict areas in Syria through the provision of life saving Risk Education messages delivered through a Risk Education e-learning tool. The primary target group is the Kobane / Ayn-al-Arab (Aleppo Governorate) returnee population, including women, girls, boys and men. Prior to the conflict, the Kobane Canton had a population in excess of 200,000 people. The secondary target group includes six civilians from volunteer mine clearance groups, Kobane teachers who will participate in Risk Education (RE) training of trainers (ToT) programmes and Kobane Community Focal Points , also trained to disseminate lifesaving RE messages to the returning Kobane population.
